title: Meet 'dragon man,' the latest addition to the human family tree
description: A cranium hidden at the bottom of a well in northeastern China for more than 80 years may belong to a new species of early human that researchers have called "dragon man."

title: US intelligence community releases long-awaited UFO report
description: The US intelligence community on Friday released its long-awaited report on what it knows about a series of mysterious flying objects that have been seen moving through restricted military airspace over the last several decades.

title: An investigation is underway into the arrest of two US siblings that was caught on video
description: After a video was shared on social media showing the arrests Wednesday of two siblings by police in Rock Hill, South Carolina, state law enforcement officials are looking into the circumstances which have sparked two nights of protests.

title: Alan Cumming on why he wishes the Pride movement didn't need to exist
description: Actor, writer and director Alan Cumming and Anderson Cooper discuss the Pride movement. Watch "Full Circle" Monday, Wednesday and Friday 6p E.T.

title: Frenchwoman who killed abusive husband walks out free after sentencing
description: A Frenchwoman who admitted to killing her husband after nearly two decades of abuse left court a free woman on Friday evening to loud applause from well-wishers -- concluding her ordeal that has appalled many in France.

title: Rudy Giuliani is in big trouble
description: In a carefully reasoned and evidence-packed decision, a New York State appellate court suspended Rudy Giuliani's law license this week. The court found that Giuliani engaged in so many clearly unethical actions while seeking to overthrow the results of the 2020 presidential election on behalf of his client Donald Trump, that immediate action was necessary to protect the public.

title: 'A punch in the gut': Van Jones' immediate reaction to sentencing
description: CNN's Van Jones reacts to former Minneapolis Police officer Derek Chauvin being sentenced to 22 and a half years in prison for the 2020 murder of George Floyd. Under Minnesota law Chauvin will have to serve two-thirds of his sentence in prison (15 years), ​and he will be eligible for supervised release for the other 7 and a half years.

title: GB News launched two weeks ago. An anchor is already taking a break
description: An anchor for GB News, a newly-launched TV channel in Britain that has been compared to Fox News in the US, said he is taking a break after just two weeks on the job.

title: What happened to beating heart cells sent to space can help save patients
description: When SpaceX's 20th resupply mission lifted off to the International Space Station in March 2020, beating heart cells were along for the ride.

title: He ran for president in Uganda and lost. Now he's under house arrest
description: CNN's Zain Asher speaks with Ugandan musician-turned-politician Robert Kyagulanyi, also known as Bobi Wine, who ran for president in January 2021 and lost to President Yoweri Museveni. Museveni claimed he had been re-elected for a sixth term despite widespread allegations of fraud and intimidation.

title: How to prioritize women in the global recovery from Covid-19
description: Phumzile Mlambo-Ngcuka, Executive Director of U.N. Women, talks about the disproportionate impact the pandemic has had on women and where to go from here.

title: Aunt Jemima's replacement is hitting store shelves nationwide
description: The nationwide rollout of the Pearl Milling Company brand name -- formerly known as Aunt Jemima -- is underway.

title: John McAfee was not suicidal, says widow of antivirus software magnate
description: The widow of controversial antivirus software magnate John McAfee said her husband was not suicidal, and blamed United States authorities for "this tragedy" after he was found dead in his cell in a prison near Barcelona on Wednesday.

title: Cubans are risking everything to enter the US
description: The four Cuban migrants stepped off the US Coast Guard cutter blinking and looking dazed under the blazing Caribbean sun. They risked their lives to cross the Florida Straits to go to the United States, only to be stopped at sea and returned to Cuba.

title: Transgender runner CeCe Telfer is ruled ineligible to compete in US Olympic trials
description: CeCe Telfer, an NCAA Division II track and field champion in 2019, is not allowed to compete in the women's 400-meter hurdles US Olympic Trials because of her eligibility regarding testosterone levels, USA Track and Field said in a statement.

title: The tragic love story behind Jackie Collins' house
description: The year after British novelist Jackie Collins died following a private battle with breast cancer in 2015, a listing went up for her 21,784-square-foot house -- an 8-bedroom Beverly Hills property inspired by the clean lines and Pop Art color blocking of David Hockney's pool painting "A Bigger Splash."

title: Iran's Supreme Leader get Iranian-developed vaccine
description: Iran's Supreme Leader Seyyed Ali Khamenei received his first dose of the Iranian-developed Covid-19 vaccine​ known as the CovIran Barekat vaccine.

title: UK health chief 'sorry' after being caught embracing aide who wasn't his wife
description: Britain's beleaguered Health Secretary Matt Hancock has apologized for breaching Covid regulations after being pictured in an embrace with his adviser, with whom British tabloid The Sun alleges he is having an extramarital affair.

title: My life growing up Black and trans in 1980s Atlanta
description: When I was 12 years old, I wore a pink shirt. Right before leaving the house, my stepfather stopped me at the door: "You shouldn't wear that. It's for girls and people will think that you're gay. It's bad enough if people think that you support them." His words were a stark lesson in gender expression. If I couldn't even wear colors associated with girls, how in the world was I supposed to be able to ever tell my family I actually was a girl?

title: Tyler, the Creator releases new album
description: Tyler, the Creator has released a new album, "Call Me If You Get Lost."

title: Channing Tatum shares touching post about his daughter
description: Channing Tatum shared a sweet daddy-daughter beach moment with his little girl, Everly.

title: Britney Spears apologizes to fans for 'pretending' to be ok in her conservatorship
description: Pop superstar Britney Spears has apologized to fans for not being honest about the reality of her controversial conservatorship, saying she "was embarrassed to share what happened to me."

title: Keilar: Fox News gave Capitol rioter the hero treatment
description: CNN's Brianna Keilar rolls the tape on how Fox News host Laura Ingraham conducted an interview with a Capitol rioter who seemed to downplay the attack.

title: President Joe Biden to name Jessica Stern special envoy for LGBTQ rights
description: President Joe Biden will name Jessica Stern as the US Special Envoy to Advance the Human Rights of LGBTQI+ Persons Friday, according to a White House official.

title: 'A great moment': Kasper Schmeichel recalls Christian Eriksen's first visit to training following collapse
description: When Christian Eriksen was discharged from hospital, one of the first things he did was visit his teammates.

title: At least one person has died from the incident in South Florida, as rescuers scour the mountain of debris
description: The painstaking search for dozens of missing people continued in the rubble of the partially collapsed residential building in South Florida as officials held out hope that others would be found under the mountain of debris.

title: The couple who travel the world recreating movie scenes
description: After going on several big trips together as a couple, Robin Lachhein and Judith Schneider, both from Frankfurt, Germany, wanted to do something extra special for their next vacation.

title: Harris set to visit US-Mexico border on Friday
description: Vice President Kamala Harris will visit El Paso, Texas, on Friday to visit a migrant processing center, following dogged criticism for not having visited the US-Mexico border and a rocky first foreign trip to Guatemala and Mexico earlier this month.

title: Pence contradicts Trump on January 6, calling plan to decertify 2020 election 'un-American'
description: Former Vice President Mike Pence rebuked former President Donald Trump on Thursday night on the question of overturning the results of the 2020 presidential election.

title: Pence rebukes Trump on election
description: Former Vice President Mike Pence rebuked former President Donald Trump on the question of overturning the results of the 2020 presidential election. Pence also said he will "always be proud" of his role in affirming the election results on January 6 following a deadly riot of Trump supporters at the US Capitol. CNN's Whitney Wild reports.

title: Why Wall Street loves Joe Manchin right now
description: "We have a deal." Those words, from President Joe Biden on infrastructure spending, were enough to trigger a Wall Street celebration.

title: Covid-19 got your nose? Study finds when taste and smell return
description: Alisson Clark first knew she definitely had Covid-19 last September when she lost her sense of smell.

title: Amazon and Google are being investigated for failing to remove fake product reviews
description: British regulators are investigating whether Amazon and Google have broken consumer protection law by not doing enough to protect shoppers from fake product reviews.

title: US golfer Lizette Salas opens up about mental health battle after taking Women's PGA Championship lead
description: US golfer Lizette Salas opened up about her mental health battle after taking a first-round lead at the KPMG Women's PGA Championship.

title: Afghan leaders set to meet Biden at White House at pivotal moment for their nation
description: President Joe Biden meets Afghanistan's leaders at the White House on Friday at a precarious moment for their country: US troops are withdrawing, the coronavirus is raging, the Taliban are making territorial gains and American intelligence assesses the government they run could fall in a matter of months.

title: Three killed as tornado wreaks havoc in Czech Republic
description: At least three people have been killed and dozens injured after a rare tornado along with tennis ball-sized hailstones hit several villages in South Moravia, in the southeast of the Czech Republic, according to regional emergency services spokeswoman Michaela Bothova.

title: Deserted Dubai Airport terminal comes back to life
description: Eighteen months ago, its terminals were teeming with transiting passengers or travelers arriving to enjoy some desert sunshine, then Dubai International Airport became a ghost of its former self.

title: Zhang Zhizhen becomes first Chinese man to qualify for Wimbledon in Open Era
description: Zhang Zhizhen will be the first Chinese man in the Open Era to play in the main draw at Wimbledon next week after the world No. 178 booked his place by defeating Argentine Francisco Cerundolo 6-0 6-3 6-7(4) 7-6(6) in the qualifiers on Thursday.

title: In China, the media doesn't hold the powerful accountable. It ensures those in power hold on to it
description: Editor's note: CNN has launched the Meanwhile in China newsletter, a three-times-a-week update exploring what you need to know about the country's rise and how it impacts the world. Sign up here.

title: Frantic race for survivors as 99 are still missing from condo collapse
See what the 'world's busiest' airport looks like as it reopens
description: After being closed for 15 months, Dubai's Terminal One has reopened, in an effort to get the world's busiest international airport back on its feet. CNN takes a look inside.

title: California school board passes anti-racism resolution after tortilla-throwing incident at basketball game
description: A school board in Southern California unanimously approved a resolution Thursday denouncing racism and racial discrimination after some community members flung tortillas at a predominately Latino high school basketball team.

title: Newlyweds ripped apart as husband detained by Chinese government
description: The Chinese government is accused of detaining Uyghurs and other ethnic minorities in extralegal detention centers, which it claims are reeducation centers designed to prevent separatism and religious extremism. Researchers say there's also evidence of a growing number of Uyghurs being jailed in formal prisons with lengthy sentences. CNN's Ivan Watson speaks to families whose loved ones have been sentenced to long-term imprisonment.

title: Malaysia seeks stricter sharia laws for 'promoting LGBT lifestyle'
description: A Malaysian government task force on Friday proposed amendments to sharia law that would allow action to be taken against social media users for insulting Islam and "promoting the LGBT lifestyle."

title: Uyghurs in Xinjiang are being given long prison sentences. Their families say they have done nothing wrong
description: Newlyweds Mehray Mezensof and Mirzat Taher were two days from leaving Xinjiang to start a new life in Australia when Chinese police knocked on their door in April 2017, seized Taher's passport and threw him into detention.

title: Surgeon General warns misinformation is the greatest threat to Covid-19 vaccination efforts
description: With a dangerous Covid-19 variant on the rise, health experts are urging people who are still hesitant to get their vaccinations. But the US Surgeon General warns a big obstacle stands in their way: Misinformation.

title: Why Britain's friends and adversaries will have watched the Russia confrontation closely
description: The flare-up between a Royal Navy warship and Russian forces near Crimea on Wednesday will have been watched far beyond the Black Sea -- and could have repercussions involving a number of Britain's allies and foes.

title: Biden bets on his own, old-fashioned belief that Washington can work
description: President Joe Biden is using words not heard in Washington for many a long year, like "trust," "consensus" and "compromise." He's even convinced that "friends" on the other side of the nation's deep political chasm will keep their word.

title: NYPD investigating vandalism of the George Floyd statue in Brooklyn as a hate crime
description: A statue of George Floyd that was unveiled in New York on Juneteenth by Floyd's brother was vandalized early Thursday morning and police are investigating the incident as a hate crime, a law enforcement official told CNN.

title: Myanmar fighting since coup has displaced 230,000 people, UN says
description: An estimated 230,000 people have been displaced by fighting in Myanmar and need assistance, the United Nations said on Thursday, as a major armed ethnic group expressed concern about military force, civilian deaths and a widening of the conflict.

title: Modi holds talks on Kashmir elections
description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi told leaders from the former state of Jammu and Kashmir that elections would be held there after the region's constituencies were reconfigured, following the revocation of its semi-autonomous statehood, meeting participants said.

title: Cows escape meat packing plant and run loose in California city
description: A herd of cows tried to escape their fate at a meat packing facility, wreaking havoc on a southern California neighborhood before most were rounded up and returned to the facility, the Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department (LASD) said in a statement.

title: Search for survivors: Video shows rescuers hard at work
description: Video shows fire and rescue workers trying to save survivors after a condo building partially collapsed in Surfside, Florida.

title: James Corden segment facing criticism for being culturally insensitive
description: Balut is a dish that Kim Saira grew up eating with her grandmother and her cousins.
